title: Unable to build mpileaks, getting a StageError
body:
Hello,

following [this tutorial](http://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/tutorial_packaging.html) I'm getting the following error when running `$ spack install mpileaks`:

[...]
==> Installing gettext
==> Using cached archive: /home/tapir/spack/var/spack/cache/gettext/gettext-0.19.8.1.tar.xz
==> Staging archive: /home/tapir/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-gzmvyrknpp3ihuiijvxhgiaxeexdy3oo/gettext-0.19.8.1.tar.xz
==> '/home/tapir/spack/opt/spack/linux-scientific6-x86_64/gcc-4.4.7/tar-1.29-2ikg7zktul4pztwxaumtrb7kae4hkwb5/bin/tar' '-xf' '/home/tapir/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-gzmvyrknpp3ihuiijvxhgiaxeexdy3oo/gettext-0.19.8.1.tar.xz'
==> Created stage in /home/tapir/spack/var/spack/stage/gettext-0.19.8.1-gzmvyrknpp3ihuiijvxhgiaxeexdy3oo
==> Error: StageError: Attempt to chdir before expanding archive.
StageError: StageError: Attempt to chdir before expanding archive.

/home/tapir/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:982, in do_stage:
     5     
     6             self.do_fetch(mirror_only)
     7             self.stage.expand_archive()
     8             self.stage.chdir_to_source()
(error on line 8)

I found [this thread](https://github.com/LLNL/spack/issues/3018), suggesting I should try `$ spack clean mpileaks` (in my case). I get the same error. When I try `$ spack purge --downloads` I get `==> Error: Unknown command: purge` (using version 0.10.0).

Can anyone perhaps point me to a possible solution to the problem?

Thanks
